citation.article-title: Gemmatimonas aurantiaca gen. nov., sp. nov., a gram-negative, aerobic, polyphosphate-accumulating micro-organism, the first cultured representative of the new bacterial phylum Gemmatimonadetes phyl. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Gemmatimonas (Gem.ma′ti.mo′nas. L. adj. gemmatus provided with buds; L. n. monas a unit; N.L. fem. n. Gemmatimonas a budding unit).
Cells divide by binary fission but sometimes show budding forms.
The major respiratory quinone is MK-9.
The main fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0, C16 : 1 and C14 : 0.
The cell wall contains no DAP isomers.
The G+C content of genomic DNA of the type species is 66·0 mol%.
The type species is Gemmatimonas aurantiaca.
